overview_of_class: First quarter in a two-quarter sequence for Senior RTVF majors in which each student focuses on directing a short film of greater ambition than is normally feasible to complete in a single quarter. Through in-class presentations and critiques, as well as one-on-one consultation with the instructor, screenplay development, audio-visual design, directing and pre-production preparation are emphasized in this quarter, though some students are also expected to be able to complete principal shooting this quarter. Research into the career paths and business and artistic practices of contemporary filmmakers whose work is inspiring to the student is also required to begin preparation for professional practices and use of resources in the film and television industry or art world.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: First quarter in a two-quarter sequence for Senior RTVF majors in which each student focuses on directing a short film of greater ambition than is normally feasible to complete in a single quarter. Through in-class presentations and critiques, as well as one-on-one consultation with the instructor, screenplay development, audio-visual design, directing and pre-production preparation are emphasized in this quarter, though some students are also expected to be able to complete principal shooting this quarter. Research into the career paths and business and artistic practices of contemporary filmmakers whose work is inspiring to the student is also required to begin preparation for professional practices and use of resources in the film and television industry or art world.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Requires acceptance into Directing Sequence program via Directing for Screen Module, reserved for upcoming seniors who are admitted through an application process.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The student will demonstrate ability to conceive and plan the overall storytelling (performance, style, audiovisual design) of an ambitious short film project and continue to develop their own personal methods and practices of filmmaking (including screenplay development), as well as engage in constructive critique of their own and their classmates' work.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Quality of presentations, attendance, lab and discussion participation, instructor and peer assessments, and meeting established pre-production and production deadlines.
